definition: hand/(formal) to hold/person engaged in certain types of work/person skilled in certain types of work/personal(ly)/convenient/classifier for skill/CL:雙|双[shuang1],隻|只[zhi1]
head/hair style/the top/end/beginning or end/a stub/remnant/chief/boss/side/aspect/first/leading/classifier for pigs or livestock/CL:個|个[ge4]

sentences.english: Even if everything dictionary at hand, we can not only lead them.
sentences.chinese: 即便手头的词典应有尽有，也不能唯它们的马首是瞻。

sentences.english: With this information in hand, you will be well equipped to advise others.
sentences.chinese: 你手头有了这些资料，将会准备好给别人的建议。

sentences.english: I used up my money decorating my new house.
sentences.chinese: 我装修新房子时用光了手头的钱。

sentences.english: She always has a dictionary by her for urgent use.
sentences.chinese: 她手头总放着一本词典以备急用。

sentences.english: He was in very low water when I saw him last week.
sentences.chinese: 上星期我见到他时他“手头”正紧。

sentences.english: So, developers only need to focus on the business problem at hand.
sentences.chinese: 因此，开发者只需将注意力集中在手头的业务问题上。

sentences.english: Now, let us finish the work at hand.
sentences.chinese: 现在，让我们完成手头的工作。

sentences.english: If you apply yourself to the job in hand, you'll soon finish it.
sentences.chinese: 如果你努力做手头的工作，你会很快把它做完的。

sentences.english: They jumped into the lake after finishing their chopping work and hurrayed out of joy.
sentences.chinese: 他们忙完手头的活就扑腾扑腾地跳下湖，大叫痛快。

sentences.english: He polished off his work in order to see his girlfriend.
sentences.chinese: 为了去见女朋友，他匆忙地做完手头的工作。

sentences.english: It’s time we addressed ourselves to the business in hand.
sentences.chinese: 该是我们着手处理手头正事的时候了。
他停下手头的工作哈哈大笑起来。

sentences.english: We have an inquiry in hand for a large quantity of bitter apricot kernel.
sentences.chinese: 我方手头现有一份欲购大量苦杏仁的询价单。

sentences.english: He punished the bottle of wine he kept.
sentences.chinese: 他把手头的那瓶酒喝完了。

sentences.english: Do whatever it takes with the resources you have.
sentences.chinese: 充分利用你手头的资源作出最大努力。

sentences.english: This will reduce the interruptions and help you stay focused on the task at hand.
sentences.chinese: 这将会减少干扰程度，有利于你集中处理手头的工作。

definition: to take possession of/to get hold of
to collect all the bits to make a whole
to snatch time/to rush/to hurry (up)/to seize the moment
lit. pulling on the lapels exposes the elbows (idiom)/strapped for cash/unable to make ends meet
variant of 佣錢|佣钱[yong4 qian5]
lit. badly burned about the head (from trying to put out a fire) (idiom)/fig. hard-pressed/under pressure (from a heavy workload, creditors etc)
hard pressed for money/in financial straits
